name: Databases
description: We will be using a database to store our application data. For this we need to first understand how databases work and how to interact with them.

learning_steps.title: Intro to SQL
learning_steps.description: Learn the fundamentals of SQL with Khan Academy's interactive course.
Select the database service for your cloud provider and complete the tutorial:

learning_steps.title: DynamoDB Tutorial For Beginners
learning_steps.description: Learn the basics of AWS DynamoDB, a fully managed NoSQL database.

learning_steps.title: Cosmos DB Essentials Playlist
learning_steps.description: Learn the basics of Azure Cosmos DB, a globally distributed database service.

learning_steps.text: Complete the Python quickstart for your database
learning_steps.description: Follow your cloud provider's Python quickstart guide:

questions.prompt: What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases, and when would you choose one over the other?
What are CRUD operations and how do they map to SQL commands?

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you ask me to explain what a database is and how it works?
Can you quiz me on the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?
Can you ask me to explain the concept of CRUD operations in databases?
Can you ask me to explain how to connect to a database from a Python application?
Can you quiz me on how to perform CRUD operations in a database using Python?
Can you ask me to explain how to use an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) library in Python?
Can you ask me to explain how to use a NoSQL database like DynamoDB or Cosmos DB?
Can you quiz me on how to model data in a NoSQL database like DynamoDB or Cosmos DB?

learning_objectives.text: Completed the Python quickstart for my chosen cloud database
Connected to a database from Python
